ygData.subject: Re: Experience gap
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, the limit changes based on level. At high levels you will be able to have a party with a much wider range of different levels than you can at low
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, the limit changes based on level. At high levels you will be able
to have a party with a much wider range of different levels than you can at
low levels.

-----Original Message-----
From: Empress [mailto:empress@...]
Sent: Monday, April 19, 1999 8:51 PM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Experience gap


i always thought that you can't group with someone four levels higher than
you, not three. maybe i misunderstood what you said, and you can group with
them, but you won't get any experience, i've never tried, so i don't know.
but as far as i know, the limit is four levels.

raista, highelf, rallos zek

----- Original Message -----
From: Chris <mailto:u1607755@...> Trubiani
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <mailto:eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, April 19, 1999 7:32 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Experience gap

Well, I set my own personal gap of never grouping with someone 3 lvls before
me, therefor a maximum of 2. >From what other people have told me, I have
no personal knowledge of this, the experience gap can be no more than 3
lvls. So if you are lvl 8 and you group with someone of lvl 12 you would
gain no exp.

Tandeyan, Dark Elf Wizard

-----Original Message-----
From: Don Bickner < bick@... <mailto:bick@...> >
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <mailto:eq_wizards@onelist.com> <
eq_wizards@onelist.com <mailto:eq_wizards@onelist.com> >
Date: Monday, April 19, 1999 8:17 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Experience gap


Since we Wizzies need to be in a group most of the time, does anyone know at
what point in the exp gap it is unwise to group with a person.I am now lvl 8
and am grouping with 10 and 11 lvl tanks and am seeing very slow exp
movement.Thanks
